text: <!channel>: Does anyone want a guide to using node.js are you guys okay using the internet?
It would be nice to see how to interact with our particular setup, at least for me
I'll write some example api routes and a simple hello world welcome page. Probably tonight or tomorrow night
Once the boiler plate is done, nodejs is dead simple
I'll prolly get a dbwrapper module ready as well
what do you mean?
Hard to explain, but basically prof said we need a clear divide between layers so it would make the dB layer distinct
ahh
Basically an "api" for our db
I thought you were going to write a ORM for mysql =))
or sqlite
Fuck that noise
I just pushed something to the iter1 branch
main.js. Basically setups up the endpoints and starts the server.  Our only rest url right now is GET /api which will give you {message: “Hello World”}
I might merge in `project_setup` or I might scrap it, since I'm not huge on there being no folder structure
Are we meeting today?
we are not.
<@U0HUKEYE5>: I prefer that you just set up the folder structure.
Cool, I'll do that
actually, I’ll try to start a folder struct right now. You can just change it if you think there’s a better way to do it.
Cool. Use lowercase and underscores if you don't mind
